msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Fix bug http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/ASC-3643 - ScriptCompiler wasn't making the symbols from one imported file available to another one.  Now it makes all the symbols from the previously imported files available to each import.
Added -swf option to ScriptCompiler.  Works the same as the Compiler swf option.  -swf mainclass,height,width will produce a swf.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Send the name of the file under analysis from ASC to the GO (helps LLVM)
Added -plugin processing to the ASC entry point GlobalOptimizer.optimize
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Invoke with -o2 switch; -o2:-allow_native_ctors needed when importing shell/player globals.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fix asdoc to work somewhat sensibly.

ASDoc comments will now always be associated with the following definition, unless there is intervening metadata that takes a comment.  Currently this is limited to "Style", "Event", and "Effect" metadata.  If there is intervening metadata that is not "Style" "Event" or "Effect" then the asdoc comment will apply to the definition.  This should fix all the problems where other metadata is inserted between the comment and the definition, and suddenly no more documentation is showing up for that definition.
For example, this comment now applies to the class, instead of just disappearing because of the RandomMetadata:
/** My ASDoc Comment, which applies to the class below, not the random metadata in between */

Also fixed asdoc so that there is now only 1 entry for each definition in the generated XML.  Before you would sometimes get 1, sometimes 2, sometimes more, and it just confused tools down the line.  Now, the last ASDoc comment is the one output into the XML.
smokes: tamarin tests, flex checkintests, asdoc builds
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

@<filename> support - if a parameter starts with @, then <filename> is treated as a file containing arguments.  The file specified is opened, and arguments are read out of it.  The arguments are delimited by whitespace (including newlines).  Any line that starts with '#' is ignored.

Change the _abc_(length, method_count, class_count, etc) constants in generated header files to be externs, and actually define them in the generated source file.  This should help with rebuilds, as the header file won't actually change if AS only edits are made.
